properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 6 at 10:21PM PST until January 8 at 5:36PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Chehalis River near Grand Mound affecting Thurston County

Heavy rain over the Southwest Interior including the South Washington
Caascades and Willapa Hills will continue into Tuesday. This will cause
the Chehalis River near Grand Mound to go above flood stage on Tuesday.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Chehalis River near Grand Mound
* from Tuesday morning to Wednesday afternoon.
* At 10:00 PM Monday the stage was 139.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 141.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 8 AM
Tuesday and crest near 141.6 feet around 4 PM Tuesday. The river
will fall below flood stage Wednesday morning.
* Impact...At 141.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Thurston County will
flood several roads in Independence Valley including James Road...
Independence Road and Moon road. Flood waters will also cover
nearby farm lands.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
